article.headline: Troy State 74, Belmont 67
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Greg Davis scored 22 points, including four in the last 20 seconds, to lead Troy State to a 74-67 victory Sunday over Belmont. Troy State (18-5, 14-2 Atlantic Sun) took the lead for good 68-67 on a layup by Jerome Stamper with 26 seconds left. Davis then made a layup and two free throws for a 72-67 lead. Ryan Heck made two free throws with 11 seconds left for the final margin. Belmont (17-6, 12-4) missed one shot and made one turnover after losing the lead. The Bruins had led by nine, 46-37, on a layup by Adam Mark with 13:21 left. They also led by seven three times late in the first half and were ahead 31-26 at halftime. Rob Lewin and Herbert Evans added 13 points for the Trojans, who shot 49.2 percent for the game to Belmont's 40.4 percent. Steve Drabyn led Belmont with 16 points, Mark had 14, Josh Goodwin 11 and Brian Collins 10. The Trojans have beaten Belmont all five games the two have played since the Bruins joined the Atlantic Sun. The loss broke Belmont's eight-game winning streak and 10-game home winning streak.
